questions.question_text: What is the maximum allowed round-trip time between standard Cisco UCM nodes?
Which two features of Cisco Prime Collaboration Assurance require advanced licensing? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
C and E correct. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/net_mgmt/prime/collaboration/11-6/assurance/advanced/guide/cpco_b_Cisco-Prime-Collaboration-Assurance-Guide-Advanced-11-6/cpco_b_Cisco-Prime-Collaboration-Assurance-Guide-Advanced-11-6_chapter_00.html#ID8

choices.C: Configure Secure Information URL to info URL.
choices.D: Configure the Directory URL to a valid directory.
choices.B: Configure Authentication Server URL to the authentication server.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
There is nothing to do there. Leave the defaults in that section. Correct answer is A.
Reference: "Configure Self-Provisioning Feature on CUCM (IVR Based)"
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/unified-communications-manager-callmanager/214233-configure-self-provisioning-feature-on-c.pdf

Selected Answer: A
should be A:
self-provisioning via Interactive Voice Response does not require idle URL. Just dial the IVR.

Idle URL is used for "URL Based" Self-Provisioning Feature, which does not require an IVR.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/unified-communications-manager-callmanager/214228-configure-self-provisioning-feature-on-c.html

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An administrator is asked to allow new phones to use self-provisioning Interactive Voice Response. Which change to the Universal Device Template implements this feature?

discussion.content:
Summary of Steps:
Create a SIP Trunk Security Profile.
Create a SIP Profile.
Create the SIP Trunk in Cisco UCM.
Configure Route Patterns for routing calls to Unity Connection.
Configure SIP ports in Cisco Unity Connection.
Set the Voicemail Pilot Number in Cisco UCM.
Configure the Voicemail Ports in Cisco UCM.
Assign Voicemail Profile to the appropriate users.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

An engineer must configure a SIP integration between Cisco UCM and Cisco Unity Connection. These components are configured already:

• SIP trunk security profile
• SIP profile
• SIP trunk

Drag and drop the components from the left into the order they must be configured on the right.

//IMG//
What is the Cisco UCM sizing guidance for deployments of between 5,000 and 10,000 users or devices that use the medium Open Virtual Archive template?

choices.A: one publisher, one TFTP, and two call processing subscribers
choices.B: one publisher, one TFTP, and one call processing subscriber
choices.C: one publisher, two TFTP, and two call processing subscribers
choices.D: one publisher, two TFTP, and four call processing subscribers

comments.content:
I revised again, I remedy some details: for the deployments A. B and C. and with the medium size OVA, can support up to 5,000 users by cluster. if these deployments where for 5,000 to 10,000 users, they would need a Large size OVA.
D. is correct and the medium OVA is correct, i was not realizing that the redundancy is 2:2 in D, and then, 2 nodes support until 10,000 users if the another 2 nodes failed.
Whatever, I continue claiming the best answer is D.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A, and C. are incorrect. Although you need here a medium OVA, this deploy would be useful if you have between 2000 or 3000 users. 
B. is incorrect. Although you need here a medium OVA, this deploy would be useful if you have between 1000 or 2000 users.
D. is almost the correct answer. With this medium OVA, it is useful for up to 5000 users. However, between 5,000 and 10,000 users, you must consider to employ a Large Size OVA.

Answer D
Between 5,000 and 10,000 users or devices
7 nodes:
1 Publisher, 2 TFTP, 2 call processing pairs (4 call processing subscribers)

Selected Answer: D
Agree, it is D:
Between 5,000 and 10,000 users or devices: 7 nodes
1 Publisher, 2 TFTP, 2 call processing pairs (4 call processing subscribers)

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/CVD/Collaboration/enterprise/14/collbcvd/sizing.html
